p: Global average temperatures are rising at a rate of about 0.2°C per decade; the rate of temperature change is much greater in some regions, such as up to three times higher in the Arctic ( IPCC, 2018). Global climate change is also initiating more frequent and more intense extreme weather events, such as heavy rainfall and heat waves causing floods and drought, respectively ( IPCC, 2018). These acute and chronic changes in the local environment and threats to animal habitats brought about through climate change have, and continue to, alter the behaviour, geographical range, and survival of many animal species ( Perry et al., 2005 ; Chown et al., 2010 ; Evans et al., 2015 ; Beever et al., 2017 ).
